problemWrapUp: The slime seems to sigh as it seeps off you and into the floor, leaving behind a small vial, which couldn't fit through whatever microscopic cracks the slime went through.
name: Tile room

exits.description: Hey, there's a wall in this direction.  You might care if you could breathe.

Hey, there's a wall in this direction.  You might care if you could breathe.
Hey, there's a closed door here.  You might care if you could breathe.
Hey, there's a wall in this direction.  You might care if you could breathe.
To the West is a room carpeted with an ugly orange shag.  You might care if you could breathe.
Hey, there's a wall in this direction.  You might care if you could breathe.
There is a large fan, not currently in use, on the ceiling.
You look down and see the tiled floor.

problemDescription: As you ponder why this room seems to get so much attention, a liquidy, gelatinous green substance falls from the counter-top above.  All too quickly, it envelops you in itself, moving as if it had a will of its own.  A voice resounds in your head 'Pitiful tiny man, I am the slime.  Answer my question, or spend the rest of your days corroding in my stomach acids.'
description: The tile on the floor of this room shines with an otherworldly brightness.  It is sparkly clean.  There are doors to the West and South, but only the one to the West is open.
